website_summaries.verdict: These weights are designed to fit Quik Shade canopies, but may work with other brands as well.
pros: Useful for surfaces where you can't use stakes, like cement or artificial grass
Two weights per leg makes it totally secure
Set of four 5-pound disc-shaped weight plates for use with Quik Shade instant canopies or similar tent canopies
Heavy cement with a smooth black polyester plastic coating
7.6" diameter weights with open slot for legs
cons: May need more than one weight per leg to make fully secure

customer_reviews.title: Received Damaged and obviously Used
customer_reviews.text: I just received these weights and they look used!!! They're scuffed up and have rust where poles have been. One of them is damaged. I ordered two boxes of them and they both looked like this. I don't mind purchasing something used if it's advertised and priced as used. Also if it's functional. Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: livnxtreem

customer_reviews.title: These don't interlock like I thought - there are way better brands
customer_reviews.text: These don't interlock like I thought - there are way better kinds that lock tight and hold the tent down as opposed to these that just slip off when someone bumps into it or the wind blows a little fierce. I also wasn't able to return these which was super frustrating. I didn't have enough time after the event which I used them for. So much for preparation.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent if your canopy is not on grass. Our canopy is on a stone patio. These weights do the job of keeping it down in wind. When we got a super bad wind that blew the canopy over the house, we bought a 2nd set of these weights and put 2 on each leg. It's working well.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Sikorski

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well to keep my canopy in place (though ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well to keep my canopy in place (though we had very little wind to actually test it), but definitely get two weights per canopy leg. Slide on onto the bottom of the leg facing one direction, and the second one facing the other direction so the legs can't just slip out of the weights.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Canopy Weigh Downs
customer_reviews.text: Easy Canopy Weigh Downs Weighs our instant canopy down easily, just slide onto the canopy feet. Stake downs are not permitted at some sporting events or impossible in some terrains, these do well. We've noticed when windy we have to turn the weights clockwise/counterclockwise so the wind doesn't blow the canopy feet out of the weights. We keep the weights in a sturdy ladies' shoulder bag so it makes carrying BOTH the weights and canopy easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lynrie

customer_reviews.title: Helps and easy on
customer_reviews.text: The weights work great when you have your tent at the fair and can't use stakes. They just slide right on the bottom of the leg where the opening is and sits on the flat part. I have never had an issue with my tent about to blow over thanks to them. They do weigh a bit so if you have back problems please be midful of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kris White

customer_reviews.title: They are weights, and they will help to hold things down.
customer_reviews.text: I do not use these for canopy weights, I use them to place on top of a speed bag platform. A speed bag platform has a lot of vibration and noise from the speed bag banging into the board at high speed. I placed thick rubber mats on top of the board and then placed these also to help absorb the vibration and sound. In that regard to work great. They were less money than regular weights and the c part of it let me tie them all together so they don't vibrate around and fall off on my head.
customer_reviews.author: JaJATop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Weights for Tents
customer_reviews.text: I use these weights for my pop-up tents - and they are perfect. They have a low-profile... sitting flush to the ground - rather than sticking up and being in the way. They have good heft and stand up to the wind. They are Heavy for sure - so be ready to haul them back and forth from the car.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Throckmorton

customer_reviews.title: Fence stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: Almost exactly what I was looking for. I needed to weigh down one end of a fence panel that I built to use as a garbage can privacy screen. It's on our driveway and attached to the porch railing on one side but needed some stability on the other side. I had this idea pictured in my head but had no idea how to make it happen and then I ran across these. They fit my one inch boards perfectly. The only thing that would make them better for me would be if each one were double the weight.
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Canopy Weights have many uses.
customer_reviews.text: I only purchased these because I needed counter weight for my new lift open coffee table. They are a much bigger than I anticipated, but they are 5 lbs each and fit perfectly inside my coffee table to keep it from toppling over when I have the lid up. I'm sure they will work on a shade canopy just find, and I will find that out next year when I go on a extended RV road trip and these will be coming with me.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Stabalizes tent in breezy conditions
customer_reviews.text: These weight work well to stabilize the feet of a 10x10 canopy tent used for doing outdoor events. They hold the legs down and keep the tent from blowing away from a breeze. Heavier weights or additional weights may be needed for windier conditions. They are portable and reasonably compact. Work well. Used for an entire season... good purchase. Beats cinder blocks and better looking than gallon water jugs tied to posts.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with item Amazon suggested
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this purchase that was suggested by amazon buy with the gazebo I bought. Since I bought a gazebo last year that was damaged by high winds I thought these weights were perfect. After putting up my gazebo we realize that these weights are the wrong size and does not fit around the legs of the gazebo as shown in a picture by Amazon. I was going to return them but didn't think it was worth the extra money to return them so I will be using these weights to hold down my patio furniture covers. I will still have to purchase something else for the gazebo. I'm really disappointed with Amazon for their.
customer_reviews.author: Si_girl43

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT TO KEEP THE CANOPY STABLE WHEN ON A SOLID SURFACE
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with the 5 X 7 Coleman canopy I use for my outside vending when I'm usually not on any soft surface where I can use the tie-down stakes. They're really simple and slide onto the canopy leg bases for that extra weight when it's breezy. I imagine they'll last a lifetime and probably outlive both me and the canopy!
customer_reviews.author: oldtart

customer_reviews.title: Great weights
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my pop up canopy on my patio. The breeze can get strong in the afternoon, and these keep the canopy In place. A much better option than the jugs of water tied to each canopy legs—classier looking too.
customer_reviews.author: treasa

customer_reviews.title: Does the job very nicely
customer_reviews.text: These were a life saver at the beach when the wind picked up. They work well on grass and concrete surfaces as well. Easy to use. A little heavy to lug with but on a windy day worth the struggle. They are supposed to be heavy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Aase

customer_reviews.title: Holds down my 12 foot Halloween Ghost
customer_reviews.text: My 12 foot Halloween Ghost comes with stakes to hold it down. Unfortunately the area where I place it is all concrete. The weight works perfect. It holds down the ghost and keeps it from flying away in light winds. The weights fit perfectly on the legs of my ghost.
customer_reviews.author: ToneB

customer_reviews.title: The weights were fine, but the tent collapsed
customer_reviews.text: The weights were fine, but the tent collapsed.....Not a happy camper, but I don't blame the weights. On a different tent, they will probably work fine.... :( They arrived very quickly and were as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy 1973

customer_reviews.title: Great weights!
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well. We set up our canopy, 10 x 20 and a gust of wind blew it over! We put the weights on didn't have any other problems. They are large enough to work well, but small enough that they are not "intrusive."
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Would work great if it fit over the legs
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, if it fits over the legs of your canopy. The cuts into the weight are far too small to fit over the legs of my canopy. Not even close. I think the legs of my canopy are pretty standard, but if yours has small legs, the idea is good.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice that I can stack
customer_reviews.text: If you're doing fairs with a canopy, you've gotta have these. Nice that I can stack, or add sand bag weights on top. One downfall... I though I could put stakes through the six "holes" that appear on the top of each one.. those are not holes... no ability to stake these in. Oh well... they still work great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick Shade Canopy Weights Kept Our Canopy In Place During Strong Winds
customer_reviews.text: Bought these weights to anchor a BBQ canopy to our deck. They fit easily around the canopys legs with the cutout design. They are small enough that they dont get in the way of people walking near them. Very impressed, kept our canopy in place during a recent storm with high winds with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Castellucci

customer_reviews.title: Not so weighty
customer_reviews.text: A little on the light side but works fine as long as the wind is not too strong. Sadly after a few months only being used one time per month one of them was dropped by two foot onto the ground and the plastic split into two piece. Saddened that it happened and expected it to be stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Eff Ewe Leo

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy enough for beach use
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first 10x10 canopy for use at out week beach vaca. Saw the weight kit and thought it was a no brainer. However, I also noticed that I've not seen anybody else using them during any beach visit. I purchased anyway and found them to be too light for the typical beach wind. Now I know why most I saw were using sand filled plastic grocery bags. I wanted so badly for these awesome looking plates to work!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Neat design, holds my canopy down
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these to hold a canopy in place for the farmer's market. Simple design, vinyl weight with a slot that fits a typical pop-up. Honestly, the only design issue I have is that they don't lock into place. If they added a keeper of some kind, this would easily be a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Good and basic
customer_reviews.text: These arrived on time and in good shape and are easy to install and use they just aren’t as heavy as they need to be for canopy in the Texas wind
customer_reviews.author: Tyky

customer_reviews.title: Quick Shade Canopy Weight Plate Set
customer_reviews.text: These work great. It is a convenient way to hold the legs of a canopy. They are heavy and it might be inconvenient to travel with. But if the wind is breezy with your canopy up. They work. And if you are on the driveway without a way to use a stake, these are good.
customer_reviews.author: SWA_superdisp

customer_reviews.title: and so far so good. If that changes
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these weights to hold down a tarp-like shelter over my garden to protect from the blazing Arizona sun. We're going into monsoon season, and so far so good. If that changes, and I find my shelter in my neighbor's pool, I shall revise.
customer_reviews.author: lovinit

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Where I live we have very strong winds,so I got these to hold my covered canopy in place because we have no way to anchor the ties and their legs to the ground. We got one of those strong winds and those weights kept it pretty much in place,did not go flying off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for E-Z UP Gazebo
customer_reviews.text: I put Swivel Stem Casters with 2" Hard Rubber Wheel 1/2" Tall Threaded Stem on the ends of the legs of the Vista Sport Recreational Instant Shelters Gazebos by International E-Z UP, 8 by 8-Feet, so that I could move it around by myself. The casters fit perfectly in the cut-out opening of the weight plates. Although I did use the weights to hold the gazebo down it did hold the casters in place so that the gazebo did not move unless I removed the plates. I used old plastic milk cartons filled with water tied to the supports to keep the gazebo in place.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: great weights!
customer_reviews.text: this is the second weight set I've bought for my popup tent and a-frame sign, to keep them from getting blown over by wind. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a problem in the past with keeping our 8' square canopy steady on windy days. These plates easily fit on the base of each canopy leg and they kept the canopy steady all day. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Green

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any canopy. I highly recommend a set or 2 as it will save your ez up from flying away in most situations!
customer_reviews.author: Axel

customer_reviews.title: When you can't use stakes to hold your shad in place...
customer_reviews.text: These weights are great when you can't use stakes to keep your pop up shade in place. We set ours up on concrete and they made sure that the shade didn't move. They are heavy, but that's the whole point! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Norcal Rob

customer_reviews.title: These are small!
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize these were so small. Wouldn’t fit around the tent so we had to zip tie them. Worked for light winds but not strong enough for higher winds.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Double check canopy leg width before ordering recommended weights.
customer_reviews.text: These weights were recommended for the BBQ Canopy but they do not fit the canopy legs. The weight openning is too small foe the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Brit HIstorian

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: They come in a big square box that's super heavy. These weights will fit a CROWN SHADES 8ft. x 8ft. Slant Leg Instant Canopy and can even be stacked on top of each other to add extra weight for a specific leg. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: They are good weights
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help weigh down another product, and it failed, but b/c of the other products design. These things are tough. they have been chucked across the yard and are still in good condition. They are now being used on a top up cover and hold the thing in place, even in the craziest of wind gusts.
customer_reviews.author: Theletterr

customer_reviews.title: Love these. I put a large 10 x 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I put a large 10 x 10 canopy out by my in ground pool. A few years ago, one picked up and blew upside down in the pool, found it underwater, ugh. These weights now give me assurance THAT WON'T HAPPEN AGAIN. ideal!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Colbert B

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Too light to make any difference. No way to attach them so they just fall if when wind moves the canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: DON'T buy THESE!
customer_reviews.text: Received these all sandy and used. Was rusted throughout too! Don't waste your money or time!
customer_reviews.author: amazonhappy

customer_reviews.title: A must have for canopies
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Simple to use and a necessity if you put up a canopy in a place where you can't poke your stakes (i.e. on concrete). Our canopy stayed put while the one next to us without weights got blown away and broke a leg. If this saves you just once from a gust of wind, it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: FightOn!Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Served their purpose. They are weights I use for my outdoor canopy. Way better than a bucket of sand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these weights before and they are easy to use and very effective. They even work well at the beach. I bought the second set because I now have a bigger canopy.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Reese

customer_reviews.title: We need to send these back --they do not fit ...
customer_reviews.text: We need to send these back --they do not fit the canopy we bought.. They say universal but I don't think they are
customer_reviews.author: Denise Turner

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for setting the shade canopy up for a garage sale on the brick driveway !
customer_reviews.author: Gianna F.

customer_reviews.title: much larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: these seem great! they are way bigger than i thought they would be. size of a dinner plate.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: POOR!
customer_reviews.text: i purchased these and they were described as new. I received a USED set that had dirt and rust from canopy legs on the inset of all the weights. If you want a brand new set, i suggest going to a actual store to buy them. POOR!
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I purchased these to hold down our canopy! Unfortunately, it stormed while camping, and these kept our canopy from blowing away. I was nervous that I only ordered 1 set of 4, but it did the job during torrential downpour and gusty winds!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Not really heavy enough
customer_reviews.text: These weights are fine in a breeze but will not hold down the canopy in a heavy wind. My canopy was ruined after a gust wind picked it up, with the weights and tossed it onto its side.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great little weight.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We got it for the beach pop up tent. Works great and it’s compact.
customer_reviews.author: Lvlfamily

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: They work well I may buy another set as I see people put two on each leg of canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Nina C. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a set of these two years ago never opened the box until this spring when I did open the box it was short one weight...these awesome people sent me a whole new set of weights , I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Only used once and there was not much need for them, meaning no wind. They seem like they will do the trick. Wish there was an easy way to carry them.
customer_reviews.author: Hello!

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: This weight is great! It kept my tent from blowing away in the winter and I was comfortable at the street fairs. It was very stable and sturdy. With the various elements encountered over time this weight stayed in pace. Therefore, I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Conqueror

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant idea!
customer_reviews.text: I used the canopy weights plates and they were easy to use, compact to pack and were a whole lot better than packing and using milk jugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy weights
customer_reviews.text: The Quik Shade Canopy Weight Plates are very sturdy weights that can hold down a canopy during hard winds. I have not had any problems with these weights. I do wish the weights came with a bag holder or something to keep them together when storing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Great for tailgaters
customer_reviews.text: If you tailgate, you need these. You won’t lose your tent on a windy day.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Bretzik

customer_reviews.title: Canopy Weights
customer_reviews.text: These arrived in their product box showing what they were. The box looked like it had been opened and taped back. The top of the box nearly torn off and you could see the weights. We hoped we could use the box to store them in when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Warren

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It held it down for about 48 hrs before the canopy flew away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these weights
customer_reviews.text: Great weights that are easy to use. Make set up a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Krystal J.

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: A must have! I was at a Jimmy Buffett concert a few months ago and a summer storm came up fast and furious. I saw at least a dozen of the pop-up tents go airborne an land in a heap of metal and material. While these may not keep the tent down in a high wind situation the surely work when it kicks up a bit protecting you and your investment. Plus they are easier to transport than cinder blocks (we saw them at the concert - they worked)!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to hold canopy legs in place, but not on a windy day!
customer_reviews.author: Ann S

customer_reviews.title: Holds the canopy down.
customer_reviews.text: Have t used them yet but had something similar and found it worked well and were practical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tent you need to have this!
customer_reviews.author: Breida Colet

customer_reviews.title: What's most important to know about this product is that they work
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about this item is that they helped anchor the pop up canopy tent. On a windy day when we forgot to take the canopy down they came in handy. The canopy survived.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough product but does not fit every canopy
customer_reviews.text: We bought these as a recommendation from Amazon to go with the Sunjoy grill canopy we purchased. It seemed like a great idea and I clicked right away to purchase, as the canopy is installed on our cement patio and wind will happen. Unfortunately, these canopy weight plates have slots that are way smaller than the legs on the canopy we purchased. Please don't follow the recommendation to purchase these with the Sunjoy grill canopy, as these do not fit that product.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy L. Benson

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: does what it is supposed to do. can't ask more than that!
customer_reviews.author: Russel A. S. Janzan

customer_reviews.title: They may work OK, but something's amiss with the "look"
customer_reviews.text: The functionality of these discs is fine; they help to stabilize a canopy an hold it up in light breezes. If you want to withstand heavier winds, you'll need two sets or more. My problem is with their appearance; I understood we were getting a "new" product; these plates were scuffed up and looked like they'd already been used. Not a "new" look, as far as I'm concerned, but we were using them at a fast-approaching art show and there was no time to return them. Let's make the item match the description, shall we?
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: These have many practical uses including holding a tent down in high winds. I also used them to hold Christmas decor on my porch.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Van Dover

customer_reviews.title: NOTE: The slits in these are small. The ...
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: The slits in these are small. The will work with Quickshade type pop ups but NOT the manufacturers with sturdier designs and larger legs. We had to return them. Unfortunately I didn't see anything in the description to indicate the width of the slits, therefore it didn't work for us. Other than that, they are what you would expect ... weights.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Wanted these cause they semes easier to travel with than those bags filled with sand. They are easier just like I thought, however they just aren't as heavy as I would need them to be. Good in mild breezes but I don't think they will hold the tent down in heavier winds or gusts. The idea of them is good but I might have to purchase/make something with a bit more weight to them.
customer_reviews.author: Hkamla

customer_reviews.title: Missing a weight!
customer_reviews.text: I can't possibly give it 5 stars since I only received 3 in the box instead of 4. They would have been great, but my tent was a bit lopsided when the wind hit. Had I gotten the entire order, I could definitely give 5.
customer_reviews.author: Djaina

customer_reviews.title: These looks like they will do the job for my pop-up tent ...
customer_reviews.text: These looks like they will do the job for my pop-up tent for craft fairs. They are definitely heavy. Can't tell you how they worked not going to be using them until October for craft fairs.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Romano-Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These work Great! I admit I didn’t think to measure me tent poles so these don’t fit around my tent poles to hold down my Event Tent~ but a Bunji cord and it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Opening is too small...
customer_reviews.text: Opening too small for the 10x 20 Caravan Canopy car port I just bought on Amazon. Don't buy these for that product. I decided to keep them to weigh down the tarp I use to cover my horse's hay UNDER the canopy. Easier than cinderblocks or rocks. Probably will last forever. Easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Vine member

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, quick way to secure the canopy on windy ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, quick way to secure the canopy on windy days. Yep, they're heavy and a little awkward to carry around, but worth it. Keeps from having to use ropes in places where the ropes would get in the way or you just can't get pegs into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Guinn

customer_reviews.title: Far too light
customer_reviews.text: The idea behind these weights is good but they should be at least double the weight. I used two on each leg of my canopy and it still went flying in breezy weather. So, unfortunately they don't really work for their intended purpose. The fillable sand bags that attach to canopy legs may be a better option.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Holds Securely In Strong Winds
customer_reviews.text: I 've found these weights to be excellent for holding a canopy in place. The canopy has been able to withstand some strong winds coming off the river recently because the the weights have held it so securely. I can't think of any better recommendation than that. ; )
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Anne Isabella

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: meets the criteria for holding the tent. have not tested in high winds yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One person set up, one micro step at a time
customer_reviews.text: After thinking it through, I was able to set it up myself in only a few minutes in a one micro step at a time basis. Taking it down myself one micro step at a time also worked. That was my biggest concern, but it became no problem and will get even easier as I use it more. The size is just right for what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Needed but akward
customer_reviews.text: We have a summer swim team with about 30-40 tent per meet. Most of the pools we swim at have poor soil and stakes don't work well. After a tent flipping incident this season, we bought a number of these weights. They work great but are heavy and awkward to move around in the quantities we need. I will most likely end up with a little wagon dedicated to just the weights. If you have never seen a tent flip with children nearby, avoid it and either stake your tents or use these weights.
customer_reviews.author: Conan Witzel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Prefect everyone who see them asks where we got them we bought 2 sets for days with more wind
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Rider-Durst

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I thought
customer_reviews.text: These fit fine with the Coleman canopy that I bought for my backward. However, using 1 on each end is not enough to hold the canopy by itself if it is windy. Maybe if you put like 3 to 5 on each leg of the canopy. I should have figured this out when I bought it since it is only 5 lbs each. I ended up tying each leg of the canopy to corners in my backyard to make sure the canopy stays up.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Blown Away
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend that you purchase the canopy Quick Shade weight plates to avoid the canopy blowing away in an unexpected gust of wind. I have been using my canopy and when wind suddenly blew lifting other people's canopies and blowing them over creating chaos.The weight plates provide peace of mind and for me was an easy purchase decision.
customer_reviews.author: DWS

customer_reviews.title: I put the canopy up on our patio, a ...
customer_reviews.text: I put the canopy up on our patio, a small wind came up and I had the weights on... it blew over, so they did not work!
customer_reviews.author: lookn cookn

customer_reviews.title: Don't have a Quik Shade canopy but these still fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't have a Quik Shade canopy but these still fit around the legs of my Wenzel. Why 3 stars? 5lbs per leg is no where near enough weight unless you only have a very, and I mean very, slight breeze. I had to bungee an additional 15lb sand bag to each corner to get the canopy to stay put; wind when I used these was approximately 5 to 7mph.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Needed these to weight down my pop up tent. Great and easy to transport
customer_reviews.author: EMG267

customer_reviews.title: Great weights!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Kept my canopy in place (I did order 2 sets) when others got toppled!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Very handy! Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these weights to hold down my canopy for vendor events. They're only 5 pounds each but they've held the tent down on average windy days. I'm not sure how well they'd do in bad weather, but we live in Arizona and don't encounter crazy weather all too often.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These weights were the perfect addition to the tent I recently purchased. I had to do a vendor fair on a windy March weekend - and the tents were set up in an asphalt parking lot. By using these weights, I was the ONLY vendor whose tent didn't start to fly away or completely collapse! They are 5 pounds each and easy to handle individually.
customer_reviews.author: sarabugstar

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for my pop up tent and work just as ...
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my pop up tent and work just as described. The quality is right up there with weights that are twice the price. The plastic is smooth and the seams are well sealed. They transport easily and do exactly what they say they do.
customer_reviews.author: Molmag

customer_reviews.title: Work well.
customer_reviews.text: Work great for the tent I have! Common sense would tell you that they probably wouldn't work in high winds! But, they did hold the tent down and did a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Love these. We use them for a tent we ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. We use them for a tent we purchased for swim meets. My only complaint would be they are a little awkward to carry. Maybe adding some kind of handle or strap to them? A strap would help keep them in place on a tent as well. Otherwise great value.
customer_reviews.author: HMBheather

customer_reviews.title: They might work in 5mph winds, but more than ...
customer_reviews.text: They might work in 5mph winds, but more than that, not going to help. I lost a $159 canopy to these weights with approximately 20mph occasional wind gusts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific! Well worth their weight in gold. Held my pop up perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: dbailey5430

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase !
customer_reviews.text: Product is solid just wish the weight was twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. The box they came in is very thick and sturdy and so far I have been able to reuse it to store them in. Makes it much easier to pack them and carry them back and forth from storage, to car, to event, and back. So, be careful when you open the box!!
customer_reviews.author: elementaryteacher77

customer_reviews.title: Item as described. what else to say they are ...
customer_reviews.text: Item as described. what else to say they are weights to hold the tent down in light to moderate wind.
customer_reviews.author: A White

customer_reviews.title: Saved my canopy from the wind!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Did an event and when the wind picked up, other's who had only stakes in their canopies had their canopies blow away. Mine was the only one that stayed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Malaika Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good idea
customer_reviews.text: These are way better than using spikes, but you really need two sets to hold a canopy in any real wind. My canopy has sides to it so it catches the wind worse, and a recent wind blew the canopy, even with two sets of these, and scratched my trailer. Without the sides on my canopy, two sets of these hold the canopy in moderate winds.
customer_reviews.author: Finer Things

product_meta.title: Quik Shade Canopy Weight Plate Kit
product_meta.description: Size:16 x 8 x 8.5 inchesAre you concerned about your canopy shelter getting knocked down or blown over? Windy days shouldn't keep you inside, and with the Quik Shade Canopy Weight Plate Set, you can set up your canopy for breezy weather. This complete set of 4 weight plates is the ideal solution for safely and easily securing any Quik Shade or similar tent canopy. Constructed from thick cement, each disc-shaped weight plate measures almost 8 inches across and weighs a hefty 5 pounds to firmly anchor down the base of your canopy at all four corners. Each of the 4 weights features a custom-designed slot for a perfect fit around the base of any Quik Shade canopy leg every time. A smooth black plastic exterior makes these weights look and feel nice and protects against scratches for long-lasting use on the pavement, decks, grass, and anywhere else you need extra stability for your canopy. Includes 4 weights; 1-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Set of 4 disc-shaped weight plates for use with Quik Shade instant canopies or similar tent canopies
Use to weigh down canopy legs and feet for added security, safety, and stability
Each weight plate weighs 5 pounds and is constructed from heavy cement with a smooth black polyester plastic coating
7.6 inches diameter weights with an open slot custom-made to fit most canopy legs
